#Text=Related Works
#Text=In this paper , we consider a multi-class classification problem with a training dataset , where K is the number of classes and is the number of the samples of the k -th class .
#Text=The size of training dataset is .

#Text=2.1. Review of K-SVCR Multi-Classifier
#Text=The K-SVCR multi-classifier is based on decomposition-reconstruction strategy .
#Text=binary SVM sub-classifiers are constructed , each of which evaluates each sample into 1-vs-1-vs-rest structure .
#Text=The classification result of K-SVCR is shown in
#Text=Figure 1

#Text=2.2. Review of Twin-KSVC Multi-Classifier
#Text=Twin-KSVC is an improvement of K-SVCR .
#Text=The Twin-KSVC constructs pairs of binary TSVM sub-classifiers , which evaluates each sample into 1-vs-1-vs-rest structure .
#Text=The classification result is intuitively presented in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=b.

#Text=The sub-classifiers and for two focused classes i and j in Twin-KSVC seek a pair of hyperplane ( 4 ) where and are the normal vector and the bias term of the corresponding hyperplane , respectively .
#Text=The two hyperplanes can be obtained by resolving the QPPs as follows : ( 5 ) ( 6 ) where and are slack variables .
#Text=For a testing sample x , the sub-classifiers and assign its class by ( 7 )
#Text=For the testing sample x , the final label can be also determined by vote rule .
#Text=2.3.
#Text=Review of THKSVM Multi-Classifier
#Text=THKSVM ( Twin Hypersphere Multiclass Support Vector Machine ) integrates THSVM and 1-vs-rest structure .
#Text=THKSVM constructs K hyperspheres in the training stage , whose classification result is intuitively shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=c.
#Text=The sub-classifier for the focused classes i in THKSVM seeks a hypersphere ( 8 ) where and are the center and the radius of the corresponding hypersphere , respectively .
#Text=The hypersphere can be constructed by resolving the following QPP : ( 9 ) where , and are slack variables .
